definition: outside appearance and inner reality differ (idiom); not what it seems/saying one thing but meaning sth different
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: But this double game is harder to maintain in the Internet era.
sentences.chinese: 但在互联网时代，这种表里不一的做法难以为继。

sentences.english: Does your character have any sort of criminal record?
sentences.chinese: 你的角色是否表里不一？

sentences.english: The worst thing (you can be )is two-faced . You will never have any friends that way.
sentences.chinese: 表里不一是最糟糕的事，你永远都交不到朋友。

definition: heart and mouth at variance (idiom); keeping one's real intentions to oneself/saying one thing but meaning sth different
two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
lit. honeyed words, a sword in the belly (idiom); fig. hypocritical and murderous
(idiom) to say one thing and do another
external appearance and inner thoughts coincide (idiom); to say what one means/to think and act as one
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
see 刀子嘴，豆腐心[dao1 zi5 zui3 , dou4 fu5 xin1]
everything for self and selfish profit (idiom); with no regard for others/selfish/mercenary
